name: APT33 (G0064)
description: Enterprise techniques used by APT33, ATT&CK group G0064 v1.2

techniques.comment: APT33 has used password spraying to gain access to target systems.[4]
APT33 has used port 443 for command and control.[4]
APT33 has used a variety of publicly available tools like LaZagne, Mimikatz, Gpppassword, SniffPass, and ProcDump to dump credentials.[3][4]
APT33 has used WinRAR to compress data prior to exfil. [3]
APT33 has used base64 to encode command and control traffic.[4]
APT33 has used kill dates in their malware to guardrail execution.[4]
APT33 has used FTP to exfiltrate files (separately from the C2 channel).[3]
APT33 has attempted to exploit a known vulnerability in WinRAR (CVE-2018-20250).[3]
APT33 has used a publicly available exploit for CVE-2017-0213 to escalate privileges on a local system.[4]
APT33 has used SniffPass to collect credentials by sniffing network traffic.[3]
APT33 has used SniffPass to collect credentials by sniffing network traffic.[3]
APT33 has used base64 to encode payloads.[4]
APT33 has utilized PowerShell to download files from the C2 server and run various scripts.[3]
APT33 has deployed a tool known as DarkComet to the Startup folder of a victim.[3]
APT33 has downloaded additional files and programs from its C2 server. [3]
APT33 has downloaded additional files and programs from its C2 server. [3]
APT33 has created a scheduled task to execute a .vbe file multiple times a day.[3]
APT33 has created a scheduled task to execute a .vbe file multiple times a day.[3]
APT33 has created a scheduled task to execute a .vbe file multiple times a day.[3]
APT33 has sent spearphishing emails containing links to .hta files.[1][3]
APT33 has used HTTP for command and control.[3]
APT33 has used AES for encryption of command and control traffic.[4]
APT33 has used ports 808 and 880 for command and control.[3]
APT33 has lured users to click links to malicious HTML applications delivered via spearphishing emails.[1][3]
APT33 has used valid accounts for initial access and privilege escalation.[2][4]
APT33 has used valid accounts for initial access and privilege escalation.[2][4]
APT33 has used valid accounts for initial access and privilege escalation.[2][4]
APT33 has used valid accounts for initial access and privilege escalation.[2][4]
